DOCNAME: CASE OF DURECH AND OTHERS v. SLOVAKIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr. PERSON and Mr ORG were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in LOC . PERSON was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . The applicants are siblings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested a judicial determination of their ownership title to a house .

CARDINAL . The first - instance court delivered judgments on DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE . The court of appeal quashed those judgments on CARDINAL DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that GPE had violated the applicants’ right under LAW to a hearing within a reasonable time .

CARDINAL . ORG had jurisdiction to examine the length of the proceedings as from DATE , but it had regard to the stage which the proceedings had reached by DATE . The case was not complex and the applicants by their conduct had not caused any delay . The overall length of the proceedings was in itself incompatible with the applicants’ right to a hearing within a reasonable time .

CARDINAL . ORG ordered ORG to proceed with the case without further delay . It also awarded CARDINAL NORP korunas ( the equivalent of MONEY at that time ) to each applicant as just satisfaction in respect of non - pecuniary damage . ORG ordered ORG to reimburse the ORG costs .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a judgment . ORG quashed that judgment on DATE on the ground that ORG had failed to assess the relevant evidence and to give sufficient reasons for the conclusion reached .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found against the applicants . The judgment was upheld on appeal by ORG on DATE . The decision was served on the applicants’ lawyer on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants asked the Prosecutor General to lodge an extraordinary appeal on points of law against the above final decision on their behalf . No further information has been made available .
